decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Careful Study, then bring them back onto the battlefield using Reanimate and Exhume. The deck aims to cheat out big creatures like Griselbrand and Sphinx of the Steel Wind to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces, as well as card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary combo pieces. The deck is designed to win the game quickly through explosive plays.

The deck focuses on putting early pressure on the opponent by deploying efficient threats like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Nimble Mongoose while disrupting their game plan with permission spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. It also aims to control the board with cards like Wasteland and Lightning Bolt, while also utilizing the card advantage provided by Brainstorm and Thought Scour to maintain card quality. The deck's ability to quickly establish a board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy makes it a potent aggro-control deck in the Legacy format.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Nimble Mongoose and Delver of Secrets, while disrupting their game plan with countermagic and removal spells. It aims to control the board early on through tempo plays and then finish the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to recover. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support its game plan, allowing for consistent access to the necessary colors of mana for its spells.

The main focus of this deck is to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul and Griselbrand onto the battlefield early using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck also includes counter spells like misdirection and spell pierce to protect the combo pieces and disruption like force of will. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats that are difficult to deal with. The mana base is designed to support the fast-paced nature of the deck and ensure consistency in casting the combo pieces.

The main concept of the deck is to use small, efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Nimble Mongoose, along with a suite of counterspells and removal spells, to apply consistent pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game by utilizing cheap spells and efficient threats to keep the opponent on the back foot. The mana base is carefully constructed to allow for consistent color access and to support the aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize control elements such as counterspells (Spell Pierce, Daze, Force of Will) and removal spells (Swords to Plowshares) to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and manipulate the top of the deck through cards like Brainstorm and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Stoneforge Mystic is used to tutor for powerful equipment pieces like Batterskull, Sword of Feast and Famine, and Umezawa's Jitte to further control the board and gain an advantage. Knight of the Reliquary and Noble Hierarch provide additional value and mana ramp to support the control strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling your opponent's board and disrupting their strategy by countering spells and stifling their important abilities. Phyrexian Dreadnought is a key threat that can be quickly put into play, while cards like Delver of Secrets and Grim Lavamancer provide additional early-game pressure. Brainstorm and Sensei's Divining Top help filter through your deck for the right cards, while cards like Standstill can slow down your opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and win through a combination of disruption and efficient threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly set up a powerful creature, such as Emrakul or Griselbrand, onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. Control elements like Force of Will and Daze are included to protect the combo, while cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder help to dig for key cards. Additionally, ramp cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb help to accelerate the mana needed to cast the big threats early on. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, game-ending combo.

The deck focuses on fast-paced aggression using low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Nimble Mongoose, supported by efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and counterspells like Daze and Force of Will to protect them. The goal is to apply early pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruption spells like Spell Pierce and Wasteland, aiming to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The deck also utilizes cards like Tarmogoyf and Thought Scour to further enhance its aggressive strategy and maintain card advantage.

The deck focuses on using powerful artifacts and planeswalkers to control the game, while utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void and Ensnaring Bridge to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to lock down the board and out-value the opponent through card advantage and efficient threats. The mana base includes a mix of lands to support a variety of colored spells and ensure consistent access to key cards. The strategy revolves around denying the opponent resources and advancing its own position through a combination of disruption and card advantage.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature beats while disrupting the opponent with hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Gaddock Teeg. It utilizes efficient removal in Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile, and has powerful utility creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Scavenging Ooze. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and disruption with cards like Wasteland. The inclusion of Green Sun's Zenith allows for flexible creature tutoring, ensuring the deck can adapt to various matchups and strategies.

The focus of this deck is on utilizing powerful artifact creatures and mana ramping cards to quickly overwhelm the opponent with threats. By casting multiple artifacts and utilizing cards like Metalworker and Grim Monolith, the goal is to get ahead on mana and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere. The deck also includes powerful threats like Blightsteel Colossus and Wurmcoil Engine to quickly close out the game. With a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive elements, this deck aims to assert dominance early and control the game until victory.

This Maverick Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. By leveraging powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Mother of Runes, alongside hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Gaddock Teeg, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of versatile spells like Swords to Plowshares and Green Sun's Zenith allows for adaptability in various situations. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's game plan and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main focus of this Legacy Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Daze and Spell Snare. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Stifle and Lightning Bolt, while digging for more threats and answers with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base is optimized for consistency and powering out the deck's powerful spells, with a heavy reliance on fetch lands and dual lands to ensure color access.

The main focus of this Legacy deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through aggressive creatures and burn spells. By efficiently using low-cost spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike along with aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Grim Lavamancer, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and finish the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Price of Progress is another key card that punishes opponents for playing nonbasic lands, further increasing the deck's ability to deal damage quickly and efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between various Elf creatures and mana-generating cards to quickly generate a large amount of mana. By casting cards like Glimpse of Nature and Heritage Druid, the deck can draw through its library and play multiple Elves in a single turn. This allows the player to swarm the board with creatures, buff them with Joraga Warcaller, and potentially draw more cards with Regal Force. The deck also includes tools like Green Sun's Zenith and Living Wish to search for specific Elves or utility cards to further advance the combo strategy.
